Posts.Content: Jul 21, 2012 11:23PM - edited Jul 21, 2012 11:23PM by ihatemyboobs I wish I were more familiar with the lingo but I do know that I'm BRCA1 negative. I was told it would be highly unlikely to be + but at the time I remember feeling like at least then I could've had some sort of explanation for my diagnosis -Of course now I feel very lucky to not get a positive result!! I guess some study is being done on other genetic mutations for bc and I was asked to take part in that research, which is cool.  It will take a year or so to get the results but, hey its worth it!

Posts.Content: Mar 27, 2012 07:25AM ihatemyboobs wrote: Hey ladies, haven't been on much since my surgery and scans but met with my oncologist today. Does everyone get a port? I understand the pros and cons but I really don't want one. I tried to put my foot down but it must be little or invisible because I got shot down, big time. I've heard nothing but " you've got great veins," and "wow, what a gusher," so I was really hoping to avoid the port but yet I'm scheduled Monday for placement. Any advice? Also my chemo regimen is 4 doses of Adriamycin and Cytoxan every other week and then 4 doses of Taxol every other week. Anyone else do this? I'm also part of a clinical trial which will add some other medicine normally given to her2+ cancers despite my her2- status. At my appointment she said that they're "throwing the book at me" because of my age. Lol, sounds great :) happy birthday to me.

Posts.Content: Jul 22, 2012 03:54AM ihatemyboobs wrote: I had so many prescriptions!! I was so worried that all of the scripts were in fact causing more SE's than the chemo would without them that I skipped my "as needed" prescriptions and did nothing but puke!!  Somehow I made it through and gained a bunch of weight.  This has been harder than losing my breasts and Im not being dramatic.  Everyone was so worried that i would lose weight! People would bring me food and give me tips on how to keep my appetite up but I was eating like crazy I guess! Oh well :(
